edu.iub.pubmed.dump

Class DumpFiles

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.iub.pubmed.dump.DumpFiles

  • public class DumpFiles
extends java.lang.Object
    Methods for creating dump files for all the tables
    Author:
    Abhilash(akoppula@indiana.edu)

    • Method Detail

      • createDump

        public java.lang.String createDump(java.util.List<java.lang.String> values,
                          java.lang.String dumpFile,
                          java.lang.String prefix,
                          java.lang.String initialQuery)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a dump file for the given values either by appending to existing file or creating new file .
        Before appending to current file , this method checks the size of the current file . If the size of file exceeds the MAX_VALUE , closes the current file and creates new dump file
        Parameters:
        values - - list of values to write to dumpFile
        dumpFile - - name of the dump file
        prefix - - prefix for file name if new dump file has to be created
        initialQuery - - initial insert query in case of new dump file
        Returns:
        - name of the dump file new or existing
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - if file Not found

      • closeDumpFile

        private void closeDumpFile(java.lang.String dumpFile)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Appends ";" to the end of the file to make the dump file a valid SQL file .
        Parameters:
        dumpFile - - name of the dumpFile
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - if file doesnt exist

      • checkFileSize

        public boolean checkFileSize(java.lang.String fileName)
        Checks the size of the given file and compares with the MAX_DUMP_FILE_SIZE value in the constants file
        Parameters:
        fileName - - name of the dump file
        Returns:
        - true if file size exceeds MAX_DUMP_FILE_SIZE else false

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(java.lang.String initialQuery,
               java.util.List<java.lang.String> values,
               java.lang.String fileName)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Appends the given list of values to the given file . There are two possible scenarios for this method . The given file is either new dump file or existing dump file . In case of new file , before appending the values initial insert query "INSERT INTO (tableName) VALUES" is added and then values are appended .

        Initial Query is used to check whether given file is new or existing . If not null , initial query and first set of values of are appended initially else all the values are directly appened
        Parameters:
        initialQuery - - Initial insert query
        values - - list of values to be inserted into table
        fileName - - name of the dump file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - If file not found.

      • createFileName

        public java.lang.String createFileName(java.lang.String prefix)
        Creates a file name by appending dumpDirectory , given prefix and current system time.

        Eg : If prefix is 'keyword_reference_' , this method returns 'dumpDirectory\\keyword_reference_YYYY-M-dd-HH-mm-SSS.sql'
        Parameters:
        prefix - - file Name prefix which is usually table name
        Returns:
        - file name for the new dump file

      • getCurrentTime

        public java.lang.String getCurrentTime()
        Returns the current time in the format specified in Constants
        Returns:
        - returns date in the above mentioned format
